review: I've never had a bad time here. I eat so much here I wanna throw up. I get the Tavern Double with no lettuce or tomato and a side of campfire sauce for the fries. I also switch it up between the Baileys shake or the Blue Moon Shake. Sometimes we get onion rings as an appetizer. We have the rewards program which we don't keep track of but it's always a nice surprise when we get a free entree. Seriously though, those bottomless fries will be the death of me. OH, and one time I left my iPhone 6 on the table and after driving home for like 10 minutes I realized it and I was like OH MAN IT'S SO GONE. But the waiter (I wish I could remember his name. He had Joker inspired tattoos.) (We talked about tattoos because my rather large chest piece was showing) was like NO I HAVE IT SAFE FOR YOU. I TRIED TO GO AFTER YOU BUT YOU WERE GONE. So mad props to him and the staff for not stealing my phone.

2 stars. Sat a the bar hoping for prompt and quick service.  Sat there for 10 mins before tender even looked my way or gave me a menu.  When I asked for a menu he told me to hold on even though he could have quickly paused to pass me a menu. Food was decent- very very very happy that their were GF options and buns. Reading these other reviews it seems as though this location is known for poor service/ when is RR going to step it up? I will not return to this location- simply wouldn't be worth it.
Great place.  Friendly staff.  quick service.   Can't go wrong here. Grab a burger and shake and you'll leave happy.
Greasy (in a good way).  Very juicy and tasty burgers.  KC was sweet and attentive. Had a fun Dad and son time for lunch.

Very unimptessive the service is slow  but friendly. Once the bartender got to me she was very helpful & nice.  The food was not impressive @ all  the bottomlesss fries are not noteworthy.  I would go back but never go out of my way to do so.  Mediocre
Very tasty burgers!! Great beer selection and young happy servers. Not your mom & pops burger joint, but very yummy! My millennial kids love this place!!

Today was the first, and probably the last, time I've ever eaten at a Red Robin.  Met my husband there for our lunch break.  It was at 12:00 so we thought it was going to be busy.    It wasn't.   First sign. Although we were seated immediately,  it took our waitress almost 10 minutes before coming to take our drink order. 2nd sign. Although we were seated right by the bar (no one else there) it took her 7 minutes to get a water and Coca-Cola.  3rd sign. We were told all about the 'reward program' but really not anything else by our unprofessional looking waitress. She took our order...we've now been there 30 minutes and our order hadn't gone in yet. A burger for $10.99 (crazy!) and a prime rib sandwich for $13.99 (better be excellent) and since I wanted the sweet potato fries instead of regular fries they would be adding on an extra $1.49!! Fourth sign. Food comes 25 minutes later...we are bith going to be late going back to work,  but we were celebrating my Bday. His hamburger was okay, but definitely can not compare to Duffy's, Five Guys or Brass Ring (all close by). He wasn't impressed by his fries so didn't order any more...even though they are 'bottomless'...which actually means the bottom of the small cylinder they serve them in has NO BOTTOM!   My 'prime rib' certainly WASN'T!   It actually tasted   (and looked) like they took sliced deli roast beef, stuck it in the microwave and put it on a small roll...it was tasteless and if I hadn't been SO hungry, I would've sent it back. The first serving of sweet potato fries (that I paid extra for-also bottomless) was hot, fresh and tasted good. When I finally got our waitress's attention and got a 'refill' the server brought this large plate with a small pile of overcooked,  greasy, shriveled up s.p. fries!  What??!  Fifth sign. Meanwhile there are now 3 other tables in her station and we have been forgotten....mgr comes up and asked how everything was....SERIOUSLY??? We told him we needed our waitress so we could leave.  It was now 1:30 !! He goes and she comes....hands my husband the bill....she didn't know that I had asked him to lunch.  I took the bill and because both of us have been in the restaurant business,  she did NOT receive 20% tip....which is what we normally give. Furthermore,  she never asked how the meal was (she probably knew) or because she knew it was my Bday, any kind of dessert.    The 'reward program' that she had spent so much of OUR time on, was never mentioned again....maybe because by now she knew this was the sixth sign that WE WON'T BE BACK.

After being to a couple of locations located out of town, it's nice to go to one that is only 20 minutes away.  Yes!  I have always been a fan of the restaurant since my first time.  Apparently, they have a sneak preview before a new location opens to the public and everybody is welcome to take advantage of the opportunity.  The bottomless beverages (no alcohol, though), entrees, and a dessert were complimentary for the ones that reserve a spot through the website.   The freckled lemonade was awesome.  It has pieces of strawberries mixed in with the lemonade.  I had to have a second one since the first one was consumed in no time.   All the menu items looked so tasty and it was so hard to pick one.  I got the A.1 peppercorn burger loaded with pepper jack cheese, onion straws, bacon, and peppercorn spread and a side of fries.  It was cooked perfectly according to request and the portion was huge.  I didn't leave anything behind because it was so damn good.  The meal was finished off with a slice of red velvet cake topped with cream cheese frosting and berry sauce.  It was a nicely sweet way to end the meal. The server, John, did an excellent job with the service.  He, as well as the other members of the staff, came by the table to ask if we needed anything else throughout the entire visit.  The managers were making sure things were running smoothly and making sure customers were happy.  I was very pleased with the visit and I look forward to returning soon.  Plus, you can go shopping before or afterwards since it's located at the Wellington Green mall.   You go, Reeeeeeeeeeeeeddddd Robin!

I was excited to see Red Robin come to Wellington since I frequented the chain when I visited St. Louis. The place is clean and most of the servers are friendly.  The food is adequate but the hamburger patties are very small; "where's the beef?" could be a mantra here.. " Bottomless fries" don't work because you wait a very long time for a refill. I do like the sauces that are available. We went several times after they first opened and will return, but it is not a place that garners loyalty because of the quality of the food. Servings are small, the burgers are nothing special and there are so many really good burger places in the area now that Red Robin needs to improve. I wish one could pick the size of burger wanted and then customize it but that is not possible here. I do not want RR to close but, sadly, that would not be a huge surprise.  I am glad they get mall traffic but the place is seldom busy.

Terrible. Understaffed, I watched them comp six tables including ours because of the comedy of errors that just came one after another. Chaos would be the best way to describe this experience. This review would be zero stars if that was possible...it was that bad. After posting I see this as an alarming trend. Perhaps another Wellington Green eatery will bite the dust. I don't wish bad on anyone but what I saw is not conducive with running a sustainable business.
Reasons why I am not returning 1. Slow service 2. Bottomless fries take 30 minutes  3. Refills are impossible  4.overpriced. For lame burgers Do not wait your money

We went back last weekend to see if they had improved their service compared to the last visit in November. I did reach out to the HQ about the prior experience and this second visit proved that they listened. The employees were much more cheerful and did not wear black lipstick. Lol We were seated on the other side of the room by the bar this time. And we were immediately greeted by a server who got our drinks right away. Nice! The good vibes we got from our server made us want to splurge a little by getting an appetizer. We went for the spinach artichoke dip. It was brought out immediately, too. It was piping hot and so good!  We ordered the clucks and shrimp basket while I got the California Chicken Club as it way usual favorite at the RR in NY. The food was brought out after a good amount of time as we just finished the appetizer.  I was disappointed in the structure of my sandwich as there was very little guacamole on it as if it was then scraped off. The server saw that and said that's not right and brought out a cup of guacamole. I began to eat the sandwich but then another problem came up, the bottom bun was completely soaked. It made eating the sandwich much more difficult and I didn't bother asking the server again. So, the sandwich wasn't as  crispy and flavorful as I remembered. The clucks and shrimp basket was good even though the shrimp was so heavily breaded.  My husband was craving for something sweet and we decided to also splurge on getting a cheesecake with strawberry sauce on it. It made up for my sandwich.  Would we come back? Very likely not. It does seem that the quality and pride taken in creating the food has gone down hill over the years despite this restaurant location being fairly new. I guess that's what happens when regional restaurants turn into a large franchise opening up in the farthest part of the US that it's not the same as the original.  I give the service 4.5 stars but the food and chef really deserves the 3 stars. Better luck next time.... If we actually go out of our way to dine here again.

Used to love Red Robin, but this location leaves much to be desired...and it's all about the quality of the food.  Today was the last straw!  My wife and I ordered 2 Southern Charm burgers with fried eggs over medium.  The first burgers came past well done with crispy eggs.  For the first time in a long while..we sent them back.  The next set of burgers came with the burgers properly cooked, but the eggs were with broken yolks and cooked well..just not crispy.  Instead of complaining again..we just ate 1/2 the burger and left.  So this month..there is a special..50% of burgers excluding Reds Tavern Double..but no discount when paying!!  When I asked..the discount us only on "gourmet burgers" whatever that is!!  Needless to say, this is our last time at Red Robin...sad

red robin, love it for burgers, but recently they have been serving the burgers luke warm and those bottomless fry are cold and stail, went on a friday evening, not very busy, just dont understand why the food comes out cold. this is unfortunate i used to like this place dont recommend  it

I have been to other Red Robins locations and had a good experience.  This location at the Wellington Mall was very disappointing. My boyfriend and I were seated in the bar area. The restaurant was pretty empty. The bartender/server was friendly and greeted us promptly. She brought us our drinks and took a while for her to return to take our order. Considering it wasn't busy,  I thought that was odd. When we ordered our food,  she asked if we wanted pink or no pink for the Burger temperature.  I said I'd like it as pink as they could make it. She warned they won't make it less cooked then medium.  OK fine,  that's their policy.  Not her fault.  The food took a ridiculously long time to come out. We both ran out of drinks at this point. Both of our burgers were well done. The bartender came back to our table when our mouths were full to ask how the food was. We couldn't really give a reply. She just walked away and brought us a refill on our drinks. I only ate 1/3 of my Burger BC it was so over cooked. The bartender was no where to be found the majority of our meal so I couldn't report it to her. Later,  I asked for more fries because I was hungry since I didn't want to eat my burger and felt the window to send it back was gone.  Again,  took a very long time to get the fries. At least they were hot and fresh. Once we were done eating, I asked a question about the milk shakes and if I could have Bailey's instead of Grand Marnier in one of them. She said there would be an up charge. I was surprised BC Bailey's is a cheaper liquor. She didn't even offer to ask management if she could accommodate my request. She had an attitude and insisted there would be a charge. If her attitude were different, I would have sucked it up and just paid the up charge and enjoyed the milkshake. I chose to skip it since I didn't want to spend anymore time or money here. And to be clear,  I wasn't upset about the up charge for the alcohol, I was upset by her attitude and lack of interest to try and resolve it for me, the slow service, and her lack of presence throughout our meal. My boyfriend finished his beer and we never saw her again,  except leaving the restaurant where she and 3 other employees were hanging out at the hostess stand. Guess that's where she disappeared to the majority of our meal. I won't be back to this location.  There are much better alternatives that will cook the food properly and give good service

Our recent visit was not as enjoyable as most. The initial hostess was cordial but I didn't understand the 10 min wait when there were several tables available including two booths clearly visible (one they seated us at) from the lobby. After being seated our waiter, Pedro was pleasant and addressed our table promptly with menus and followed with drinks, our order, etc. At that point, it started a downward turn. For an item that a regular on their menu, the appetizer took awhile to come out. That's when I noticed it, no napkins but no crisis yet - pretzels aren't messy. Then the real wait began ... and the tea ran out ... and the kids are bored and hungry. We're getting aggravated. Our server came by and advised our food is on its way out - psych! It didn't come out for another 10 minutes. Yum, we're hungry, getting short on time, etc - let's eat! I took my first bite and that's when I remembered, crap no set-ups and my hands are greasy! Uugggg. I see our server darting around but I can't get his attention. I asked the other hostess (one with a bad attitude named Tyler?) for napkins and utensils. I watched her bypass the basket a few yards away and walk all the way back to the kitchen where our server was to tell him (SMH). Shortly before we left I saw her do the same thing with table behind us. It's not her job, I get it but you are all there to serve your customers. Why wouldn't you help your coworker and then work out the "not my job" crap later?! It's just not a nice practice all the way around.  In regard to the slow food, thinking back I realize that seems to be a SoFL RR thing so don't come if you're in a hurry, with cranky kids, or super hungry. On the flip side, the burgers are good and the menu has a lot to choose from.

Great place for burgers. Their strawberry lemonade (called the Freckled Lemonade) is to die for!! My absolute favorite! And when you're not in the mood for burgers, they have a wide variety of other dishes to try!

Never been to red robin before. Great freckled lemonade! Definitely a good place to hangout with friends and enjoy the environment. Not noisy at all and was seated really fast for having a party of 15. Recommend this restaurant to everyone.

There are two Red Robins locally; Wellington Green & PB Outlets.  Both are nearly identical in quality. My opinion is that despite the claim of "gourmet burgers", these fall short. They're not terrible burgers, but you definitely will find much better around the area. However, if you don't judge a good burger by the quality of the patty, you may like Red Robin because they have a variety of special/unique burgers that may appeal to some. For me, I judge a burger by the quality of the patty.  For that, I'd prefer to head down the street a couple miles to Cityplace and hit BurgerFi, or up to PBG where I'd get Vic & Angelo's burger (despite being an upscale Italian place, they have a great burger).  I'd mention Shula Burger if they were closer.

First experience at a Red Robin and I can definitely say it was a good one! The burger was delicious, and the sweet potato fries are really the only choice. All in all, I'll definitely be coming back.

Yes, this place wasn't that good. Yes the service was a bit slow for my taste. But don't leave reviews with names. It's okay to not enjoy but don't name drop. That's just rude. Anyways, this place just opened up, so my family wanted to try it out. We had arrived at a busy time when the place was packed. The hostess told us it would be a few minutes before we could be seated. So we walked around the mall to get out of the congested front area. We came back in 25 minutes or so, but our hostess told us she called us on our cell phone, and that our table was filled because we didn't answer.  No big deal, we waited no more than 2 minutes and she said she had a table for us. We were seated, and then got our drinks quickly. Our server brought out the bottomless fries, while we all decided what burger we wanted. ( I can't really remember which ones we got, but they weren't bad tasting just plain.)  We then played the waiting game while others around is got their food first. The fries were no longer helping our hunger. Finally after 30-45 minutes of waiting for our food, we were a bit disappointed. They had a picture of this special burger, that my brother ordered, and it looked nothing like the picture. After that satisfying experience, we just payed the bill, and left. It wasn't expensive nor was it cheap. But for me personally, I wouldn't eat there again.

So I walk in through the outside entrance. No one is there. Someone comes over and tells me to walk down the carpet and someone will help me there. No one did. So I found my way to the bar where I was ignored by the bartender. He said I'll be with you in a moment. Five mins go by and I finally ask if I can see a menu. So he gives me the menu and finally I get to order.  After I order, everything is great. The chips and dip for $3? Outstanding. The Bailey's shake, very tasty. Even for $7.49. I got the chophouse burger. I taste it and although it was overcooked, it was good. I alerted the bartender to it being overcooked and he had it replaced. All in all, it was very tasty and relatively inexpensive!
I don't know why but I love this place when I'm craving a burger and fries. It's super cheap and nothing special but it does the trick when I'm craving a burger and fries.

I had a lot of hope that this place would get it together and be as good as the ones in other parts of the country but after several months, apparently that isn't going to happen. Hadn't been here in a while partially because of past experience and the desire to eat healthier but it's my bday month and who can pass up a free burger!? Thank goodness it was free because I already regret going here. Came for lunch and our server tried to give good service but then was sat about 6 tables at once. Food didn't take very long but it didn't come out right and our server, who looked like the only one working, was busy running around. Burger was ok, fries were cold and by the time free ones came we were done. Then the check came, at the top it said my burger was free but then the total due still included the $8.99. Apparently that's a thing because the Manager and server both made some comments that raised eyebrows at my table.  Sorry, I don't like to badmouth anyone but this place gets a   next time I want a burger I'll go to whole foods or lindburgers or five guys even. This place had so much potential but to me it's dead now.

The resturant opened May 12. It was busy for a wednesday afternoon.  I did notice that the service was a little slow. We were seated immediately. The server did take a while to great us. The drinks also came later than usual. Our entrees came out in a timely manner Ordered the "bottomless" lemonade drinks. Pretty good. Entrees ordered was the simple burger with pepper Jack cheese. The simple burger tasted pretty simple. It was a basic and needed flavor. The tavern burger was good and tasteful according to my eating partner..my husband. My little kiddo ordered the chicken fingers and fruit...he's eating it so I'm figuring its good. The fruit salad has some type of red sugar coating on it. Thanks to that he's eating the apples.  Our server Crystal was very nice and informative. We will be back since we are now red robin royal members!

Good food. Very rich; one burger lasted two meals and that's ok with me. I ordered the Whiskey River with fries and it was delicious. It was chaotic because it was the first week, but we expected that.  What we didn't expect was the lack of marketing. We didn't even know it was open. While places like Trader Joe's has been blasting our mailbox with pre-opening specials, Red Robin hasn't marketed themselves very well.
So this is my first time and the place is a hot mess truly  staff running around like a chicken with no head and no leader running them wth

Walked in and there was no hostess. Wait time was 15 mins for anyone to even acknowledge us. Once we were seated, it took 15 mins for anyone to come over and order our drinks. Three of us in the party; we ordered two drinks, an iced water, a smoothie and two shakes (we like variety). We also ordered chips, guac, salsa. They brought out two drinks. That's it. Five mins later they brought out our chips. Took another twenty for someone to come back and take our order. We also took this time to ask for our shakes and water. The guac was disgusting. It came out brown. Really brown. We requested something else, which took another 15 mins. Finally we're only waiting on the food. We waited 45 mins and finally decided to request a check without the food. Right when we were going to, the manager comes out with the food. When we told her we didn't want the food, she got upset. She got an attitude and sat down to talk to us. The funny thing is she only brought out two burgers. There were three of us, and one of us ordered a soup as an appetizer. Should've been the first thing out. She offered to comp the entire meal, we said no. The experience was that bad that we didn't even want it for free. We left and immediately went to the food court.

If you want to take forever come in here. It is beyond slow. Not only does it take forever for the waitress to take your order but it also takes ages for your food to be prepared. The food is not as advertised. I honestly think McDonalds would be better than this. Never have I experienced such horrible service. Seriously do not even think of coming in here, just walk 5 steps to McDonalds.

Poor service, not only did it take a very long time to get our food. When it arrived the sweet potato fries were burnt, my turkey but key was good but gave me an upset stomach after. We will not be back.

Ok, I went to this location, probably back in November 2014, but am just now getting around to writing my review (sorry!).  Our party (3 adults, 2 kids) arrived first thing, in fact we were the very first customers the day we went. We were seated fairly quickly, but after that everything went down hill. It took a while for a server to come over to our table, by the time he did we were ready to order and placed both drink and food orders at the same time. As we sat, waiting on our food, other customers had arrived and some actually received their meals before we did! About 20min. after ordering the kids meals finally came out (great!) we assumed that since it had been so long our food would be out shortly thereafter...NOPE! 25 min later (thats 45min. after placing our initial order) the adults food came out...mind you it was only burgers...nothing that should take 45mins! To top it all off, I had ordered my burger plain and it came out with everything on it! I sent the burger back and the server brought it back out about 2min later, took a few bites and got an odd taste, opened the burger to find cheese covering up some onions...what they had basically done was scrape off what they could, and then covered it with more cheese. When we were waiting on the adult food I did speak with the kitchen manager and he honestly (to me) acted like he could care less about our concerns, when our food finally came out and our order was wrong, i went back and talked asked to talk to the manager again, only to have the kitchen manager come back out...I finally said I wanted to talk to the general manager (who was doing inventory that day) and he came out and apologized and made me a new burger (to-go) himself and paid for our entire meal...this is the only reason i gave a star, because at least he did something about the situation. I haven't been able to eat there since, it makes me sick to my stomach thinking of it...but my son loves the place (bottomless mac and cheese) so we may try again soon...and I will update with the results of that visit...if its better!

We have eaten at many Red Robin restaurants around the country as we travel. This one was very disappointing. The burger was Blane. The fries were small and not as good and fluffy as they normally are. We won't come back here. The place was almost empty but they took a long time with our food. One star. That is all I can give.
Food is what you'd expect from a chain, edible but nothing fantastic Server delivered food and vanished. Hostess is a dolt, place was empty and sat us next to the noisy kitchen.

I was nice enough to give this place two stars simply because the server at our table was phenomenal. I wish I had gotten his name so I could share it, he was one of the only saving graces for this establishment. The wait time was long, the entire restaurant was smokey, the burgers were not good, and afterwords the entire group I was there with got food poisoning. Very unpleasant experience, I will not be returning.

Ugh is all I can say. Service - not only was ours horrible but we saw two others walk out. Never saw a manager around. Took forever. Drinks - Shake was good. Husband got one beer in 1.5 hrs. Waitress never replaced. Food - my chicken sandwich was good, nothing spectacular, just a sandwich but was served with fruit mushed. Yuck. Everyone elsewhere had burgers. Two were ok but I'd say Burger King quality at $12 prices. One was disgusting. The only reason I gave it two stars was because the manager sent us a gift card to return. We went to the Palm Beach Lakes location with the gift card and it was just as horrible.
Cheap fast food. Not worth it at all. After you eat at Red Robin you will realize their gimmick. They offer fast food with a wait staff so they can mark the burgers up 4 extra dollars. Dont bother
service was great, my wife and I had salads ( in a burger place) . Burgers did look good from what I could see. Signed up fir the loyalty plan Very busy with parties.

Ordered one of the burgers that was on the limited time menu and didn't get what I ordered at all. Under staffed, service was slow and they had at least 2 servers on the floor during dinner. My burger was over cooked, menu said pepper crusted bacon... I got regular bacon... Like The cooks thought I could tell the difference, again menu said arugula... I got bib. If you are oblivious and are convinced Red Robins burgers and awesome then have fun being main stream and continue to support this and all of this corporate disappointment to anything culinary related.

Good food. Heavy on the burger choices, not a lot of other items but it is a burger place.   That being said,  their soups, salads, wraps are very limited but very good.     Service is ok.  My big issue is, they seat us in the bar, and the bartender is responsible for serving while also working the bar.  I know he's working hard but I have to go chase him down for anything.  Had to ask for napkins, silverware,  etc. This is the second time that we've been seated in this area and it happened both times.   Will definitely not sit in this area again.

Here's the problem..the food was pretty good but the service is not. Waitress apparently was assigned too many tables and this will be the downfall of this location. Also not once were any of our extras drink cups, extra plates removed from table. Hopefully management reads this and has a proper training review??

Our server was better than average, but the food was nowhere near what the menu advertised. Not to mention the cooks are SLOW. You would think with the time they took to prepare our meal that it would be perfect; not so much. It seems macaroni and cheese is the lowest risk meal on the menu, but only because it's hard to screw up. When one burger comes out hot and the other cold, something on the cook line is amiss, either the expediter or the cook (or both). Sad to read that the majority of the ratings reflect the same issue over a year's time; far too many to not see a pattern. Note to Red Robin: fix the problem or shut the place down.

We went there one night and didn't really know what to expect, we'd never been to a red robin. The restaurant was freezing!!! We had to use layers of the clothes we had just bought to keep warm. It wasn't really anything special, the burgers were kind of wet actually, maybe from the grease, and small. Over priced for what you got. And they tried to make up for it with bottomless french fries, but again, nothing special. I don't know if we'd go back, we weren't really impressed. Nothing awful, but probably not something we'll crave again.
Hostess was friendly, server was attentive, food was good and the beer was cold. Nice that they had a local beer on tap.

Food was okay.  Three meals came out on time. And one burger took an extra 35 min to deliver. And then another 15 to pay the check. Waitress lied and said talk to manager three times.  Worse service ever!!!

I'm not sure what all the hype about this place was all about. I ordered a turkey burger and it was do terrible we had to send it back and I never ate.  My husband was not impressed by his burger either.

Five stars for excellent service from Ryan! If not for him it would be three or four stars. They need to clone him! I had their burger my first visit(I'm not the biggest burger fan to begin with) and it wasn't absolutely terrible but not something I'd order again. The bottomless root beer floats are why I return!
We always have a blast here. This time around Taylor helped us and she was fatastic, my picky burger was perfect, so know I had to Yelp it.... of ur at the Wellington mall, stop in....

The best thing about our visit was the onion rings, very tasty! Although it was busy, we were seated pretty quickly and greeted fairly quickly as well. I ordered the A1 peppercorn burger with the bottomless fries & the bottomless root beer float, which were great. The only thing I didn't like about the visit was the service. Our server never came back to check on us, or give us any refills on our "bottomless" beverages. Overall I was pleased with the food and disappointed with the service.

The food was ok nothing special.  Our app of pretzel bites were still cold inside. They did quickly replace them.  We sat in the area near the kitchen. It was very annoying hearing the lady calling out for runners very loudly.  Our waiter Pedro was very nice and was attentive.

The burger are wonderful. Many more options then I thought. Great bar with amazing drinks. Gabby was great. The kids had a fun time, Tv everywhere so it going to be a great place for game days ... I can't wait to go again

I love burgers but these were meh. I did like how they text you when your table is ready. We waited about 20 minutes on a Saturday afternoon. I did like the garlic fries though, but the burger wasn't anything special. Don't think I'll be back unless someone pays for my meal.

horrible horrible experience here. no surprise because the reviews are all consistently bad. we had a gift certificate so we had to come but trust me, we will never come back. they completely messed up our order, had no idea what kind of food their kids meals are made of and did nothing to fix the situation. we will never be coming back and I cannot wait for this place to close down so we can get something new.

I love this place. Working close to this restaurant I'm often here on lunch. The service is excellent, the food is amazing. It will leave you full for the rest of the day though. Don't forget to swipe your rewards card, it's defiantly one of the better rewards programs out there. The management is excellent too, they are always running around. This is a great place to either have lunch or dinner. The burgers are on the pricer side but they so have cheaper options. Try the red tavern double.

The service is very underwhelming as it has been 40 minutes and I am still waiting for my food on a Wednesday night. I was hoping that the service would improve after opening week but sadly it continues to be subpar. It is also extremely cold inside the restaurant so bring a jacket.
Good burger, I didn't care for the way it was presented.  A burger on a plate with a metal sleeve with French fries in it on a piece of wax paper.

Had not been in a Red Robin since living in San Diego 20 years and having then their tasty burgers, was looking forward once again to their savory burgers but what a disappointment  I experienced having my Royal Red Robin Burger, nothing " Gourmet" about them YUCK. Don't waste your money.  It was expensive for poor quality burger. Especially noteworthy the 1200 calories burger you'll be ingesting

Another awesome Red Robin restaurant! I'm so glad to have them opening here, as I became a huge fan living in San Diego and I just moved back to West Palm. We had great food and great service. I'm such a huge fan of their turkey burger. I also enjoyed the "classier" look to this new restaurant - the other Red Robins I've been to have all the goofy stuff on the walls. I'll certainly be back often!

Tried this place twice. Both times terrible . Never again. Came here in the late evening, around 8 pm for dinner. Didn't wait long to be seated. Once we ordered our food, the wait began. Took close to 40 mins for our food to arrive. My daughter ordered the french dip, it came out cold and the cheese was not melted whatsoever. incredibly salty. I had ordered a burger. The lettuce was rotten, and well, that did it for me. Lost my appetite completely after biting into it. My daughters bf also had rotten lettuce on his burger.My stepson ordered a cheeseburger without tomato. It had tomato on it, which the cheese was melted into. had to peel off the cheese in order to eat it without the tomato. No biggie but was it messy! It was the burger with fried egg on top. As for the fries, well they were so salty we could even eat them. We asked to speak with the manager about all of this, he came over and RUDELY asked "whats the problem" Then says, What do you want me to do? Really???? You should know what to do... Wanted to make us new plates, well by this time its after 9 pm.  He comped my sons meal, after I told him it was mine that wasn't eaten, he took mine off as well. But charged me $3 for the seltzer water I didn't even drink. Ok, that's fine. We also watched several table around us sending back food as well and asking about the long wait. After the second try here I can say I will not be back.

We were seated in the bar area. The only employee present was the bartender who had to serve as waitress while simultaneously tend bar. When we were seated, there was only one other table seated in the area. It took a fair amount of time for her to take our orders. By the time our food came (a very long time) our drinks were empty and we were not asked if we would like refills until after we started eating.  I ordered the blue burger with the steak fries. The burger was bland and had no flavor. You wouldn't have known blue cheese was on the burger if it wasn't for the title.  The fries were warm and also bland even after adding salt, pepper,  and mustard.  My dining parter has the signature red robin burger which he described as weird. But he did enjoy the side salad. When we were finished,  the bartender was busy bar tending and there was finally a waiter who took another table's order and then blindly walked past us as we tried to flag him down to get our check.  Never eating here again.

Tried this place a few months ago and although the food was OK service was terrible! We decided to give it another shot. BIG MISTAKE! Again it was the service! It took forever! I asked for Mayo 3 different times and when I finally did get it, my burger was cold. The kids asked for more fries and the waitress said she would check as the fries are running behind?? Dont get that! If you have a resturant that offers unlimited fries, they should constantly be making them!The manager came over about 20 min later with the new burger and said they were working on getting service better. took the burger off the bill gave me his card and told me when we come back to ask for him personally and he would see that we got the service we deserved. Yea...thats not gonna happen! We will NEVER go back! The extra fries came out as we were leaving.

I've been here three times . Two out of those three times I've had terrible experiences. The first time it was the opening week and the place was packed. I ordered a bruschetta chicken sandwich and it was horrid. The chicken was dry and the bun was super soggy. The fries were terrible, as I can see why they're bottomless. Horrible time. I went the second time as I was getting some last minute things at the mall for my trip to London. Me and my mom were the only two customers there. I got the Red Robin gourmet cheeseburger and it was alright. Not as bad as the last time. The fries were mediocre, just like the first time. The third time I came there I was with my dad and brother, having a Saturday at the mall. I got the mushroom Swiss burger and it was just as bad as the first time. Bun was soggy, burger was undercooked, fries were mediocre, and it was HORRID! Will never go back to this place again!

Starving and freezing!  If you're in the mood for a great burger (veggie included), this is the place to go, but be prepared to wait and bring your snowsuit.  This is my second visit to the Wellington Red Robin and both times, the service was slow and the restaurant was uncomfortably cold (making the wait feel even longer).  Fingers crossed that the PB Lakes location will serve up more than good food.  I'm a fan of the whole dining out experience and this location just doesn't measure up.  In a hurry?  I recommend take out.
Great burgers but sooooooooooo slow. So terribly slow with service. Over an hour from seating to receive entree. Even a glass of water took twenty minutes... Uggh

My wife raved about it and how great it was out west. Finally tonight we ate there, and glad that we did. It was out of this world food and service. I had the DGB (Damn Good Burger  and my with the bacon cheeseburger with onion rings. For the past couple years when I ordered a burger I was bored half way through. Not this time, every bite was an experance. And the bun OMG! how great was that. My wife stole my garlic dressing for her burger. Mickey was our water and a damn good one at that. We did eat at the bar. It is now our fav place to eat. The drinks were great as well.

Love this place! Would give it 5 stars, however it depends on which server you get, Monica is great! Some other servers just treat you like you're a sale, asking you multiple times if you want to try this item, or that item, which I get, higher bill=higher sales=potentially higher tip.  Only problem I have is that all 3 times I've come, I've ordered a burger MR, and all 3 times it has come out medium at best.  I've worked in the restaurant industry, both upscale, and typical franchises, and I have noticed that in the more franchise (i.e. Chilis, Applebees, T.G.I. Fridays) based restaurants, they simply ask "Pink or no Pink".  I think that that is a little ridiculous, there is a very wide array of temperatures rather than just Pink or not.

Went with a party of 8 on 6/7/14; arrived around 6:40 pm and our group was seated around 7:15. Our waitress was pleasant enough but it quickly became clear she was very inexperienced. After getting our drinks she disappeared for quite awhile. Then she disappeared again after taking our dinner orders. We were looking for her to check on the status  of our food after waiting for another 1/2 hour!  She e was m.i.a. so we asked another server to check on our order and she was extremely rude. Fed up after seeing other diners who were seated after us get their food, we asked for the manager. She apologized and went to find our server who then finally appeared and apologized as well,  but still no food. Finally,  nearly an hour after we were seated, 6 out of 8 of our orders came out. 2 of those with cold food. One in our group ordered a garden burger (vegetarian) which she sent back since it had clearly been sitting around and was ice cold. When they brought her a new one,  it had a slice of bacon in it In the "vegetarian" burger. Thank goodness she saw it before biting into it. Other burgers that were ordered as well done were rare. While we understand that it takes a newly opened restaurant awhile to get the "kinks" out,  this is an established chain and after being open for a month, these kinds of blunders don't bode well for the expected service in the future from this location. We were excited to finally try Red Robin, but ended up being thorough disappointed.

The Red Red Robin should go bob bob bobbing along until they get their act together!  The Yelp reviews and the line at the door at 6:30 made us believe the 7 of us were in for a great "gourmet" hamburger as the ads said. The picture of the nice thick juicy burger looked so mouthwatering delicious. NOT! The first sign was that the "gourmet burgers" had to be ordered medium well or well done. In other words, the burgers were frozen and had to be over-cooked to temperature. Second, it took an hour for our order to arrive, and only 4 out of the 7 orders at our table were as ordered.  Third, the nice juicy burger in the ad was a lie. The burger is about the size of a McDonalds, but you do get two of them, so you have two well done hockey pucks! Two of these went back to be cooked as they were black and crusty, as did another meal that was made incorrectly. One "riblet" dinner was so over-cooked it looked like charcoal. The entire evening was ruined and it was was a terrible experience. I will say the server was so very apologetic and nice, and the manager came by and took the three meals off our bill and remade my wifes burger, but all in all the 7 of us scratched this place off our list of dining establishments. With Duffy's, Limburgers, and many other places to get great burgers made from fresh meat that can be cooker rare to medium for $2-$3 less than Red Robin around this area that unless you're trapped in Wellington Mall during a hurricane, there's no reason to go there.
